Scheme Name: ICMR- Post Doctoral Fellowship (ICMR-PDF)
Description: ICMR-PDF Scheme is instituted to foster high-quality research opportunities for promising fresh Ph.D./MD/MS holders in basic science, communicable and non-communicable diseases, and reproductive health including nutrition at ICMR Institutes/Centers. The fellowship aims to support fundamental research in cutting-edge areas of science and other priority fields identified by ICMR.
Eligibility: Indian nationals only; Fresh PhDs/MD/MS within three years of completing their degree (awarded) as on the last date of the application; Proposed research work should continue the candidate's Ph.D. or MD/MS research work; Maximum age limit is 32 years, relaxable up to 5 years for SC/ST/OBC/PH and women candidates; Deserving candidates may receive an additional 3 years' relaxation based on prior work, publications, and awards.
Tenure: Two years, extendable for a maximum of one more year based on outstanding performance.
Benefits: ₹65,000 per month plus HRA as per government rules and NPA as admissible; Contingency grant of ₹3,00,000 per annum (25% can be used for national travel related to research work); Accommodation may be provided at ICMR Institutes/Centers, but HRA will not be paid in such cases; Medical benefits and leave as per ICMR rules for JRF/Research Associates.
Application Process: Offline submission by 30th June or 31st December every year; Visit the official ICMR website to download the application form; Complete the form, ensuring all sections are filled; write 'NA/Nil' where applicable; Attach self-attested copies of required documents; Submit the completed application to the address mentioned in the guidelines.
Selection Process: Selection through an interview conducted by a Selection Committee based on publications, citations, and impact factors; Interviews are held at ICMR Headquarters, New Delhi; Applications must be routed through sponsoring ICMR Institutes/Centers.
Required Documents: Passport-size Photograph; Attested copy of School Leaving/High School Certificate for date of birth; Attested copies of Mark Sheets/Grade Cards & Degrees; Caste certificate, if applicable; Reprints of publications; One-page summary of Ph.D. thesis; Attested copies of Letter(s) of Acceptance for paper(s) accepted for publication; Detailed research proposal; Testimonials from two referees (one should be the Ph.D. Guide); Plagiarism Check Report verified by ICMR-RIO.

Scheme Name: Dr. Ambedakar Centrally Sponsored Scheme of Post-Matric Scholarships for the Economically Backward Class (EBC) Students
Description: The objective of the scheme is to provide financial assistance to Economically Backward Class (EBC) students studying at the post-matriculation or post-secondary stage in India. Scholarships are awarded by the Government of the State/Union Territory to which the applicant belongs. The scheme is designed to enable students to complete their education.
Eligibility: Indian nationals belonging to the General Category (other than Schedule Caste, Schedule Tribe, and Other Backward Classes)
Students pursuing recognized post-matriculation or post-secondary courses in Government institutions in India
Students pursuing post-graduate courses in medicine (provided they are not allowed to practice during the course)
Income from all sources of the student's parents/guardians should not exceed ₹1,00,000 per annum
Students must not be studying in commercial pilot license or aviation-related courses
Only two boys of the same parents/guardians are eligible to receive the scholarship, though this restriction does not apply to girls

Group A.Description: Degree and Post Graduate level courses including M.Phil., PhD, Post Doctoral research, Engineering, Technology, Medicine, Management, and similar fields.

Group B.Description: Graduate/Post Graduate courses like Pharmacy, Nursing, Mass Communication, Hotel Management, etc.

Group C.Description: General courses leading to a graduate degree like BA, B.Sc., B.Com.

Group D.Description: Non-degree courses like ITI courses, senior secondary certificates, vocational courses, and others.

Additional Benefits.Study Tours: Up to ₹900 per annum for professional and technical courses (based on actual expenditure).
Additional Benefits.Thesis Typing/Printing: Up to ₹1,000 for research scholars (based on recommendation).
Additional Benefits.Fees: Scholarship covers compulsory fees such as enrollment, tuition, library, medical, etc., but excludes refundable deposits.

Duration of Awards: The scholarship is tenable from the stage at which it is granted until the completion of the course, subject to good conduct and attendance.
Renewal of Awards: Scholarships are renewable annually if the student progresses to the next class of the same course, subject to performance and attendance.

The fellowship aims to develop independent scientific profiles and augment high-quality manpower in scientific institutions.
Eligibility: Indian citizens or People of Indian Origin with Ph.D. degrees in relevant fields, aged 27-32 years (relaxed for SC/ST/Women up to 37 years, and Divyangjan up to 42 years). Candidates must have a minimum of 60% marks throughout their academic career and publications in reputed journals. Applicants awaiting their Ph.D. award can apply but must secure their degree before selection confirmation.
Benefits: Fellowship of ₹1,25,000 per month with an annual increment of ₹2,000 and a Research Grant of ₹7,00,000 per year for five years. The fellowship is taxable as per Indian IT Act.
Required Documents: Passport-size photograph, Class X Mark Sheet or Certificate (proof of Date of Birth), Academic certificates from Class XII onwards, Caste Certificate (if applicable), Letter of appointment (if employed), Professional recognitions and awards, Research experience, Budget breakup for research grants, and Endorsements/letters from host institutes.

Description: The DBT Junior Research Fellowship (JRF) program provides financial support to Indian students pursuing doctoral research in biotechnology and life sciences. It is open to candidates with a master's degree in biotechnology or related fields.
Eligibility: 1. Applicant must be an Indian citizen. 2. Must have a master's degree in biotechnology or a related field from a recognized university. 3. Should have cleared the GATE or NET exam in biotechnology or a related field. 4. Age limit: 28 years for General and EWS candidates, and 33 years for SC/ST/PH candidates. 5. Must be willing to pursue full-time doctoral research in biotechnology or a related field at a recognized university or research institution in India.
Benefits: 1. ₹31,000 per month for the first two years. 2. ₹35,000 per month for the remaining three years.
Required Documents: 1. BET exam scorecard. 2. Research proposal. 3. No Objection Certificate (NOC) from the current employer (if applicable). 4. Passport-size photograph. 5. Signature. 6. Date of birth proof. 7. Academic transcripts for all degrees obtained. 8. Category certificate (if applicable). 9. Persons with Disability (PWD) certificate (if applicable).

Steps: Qualify in the Biotechnology Eligibility Test (BET): The BET is a national-level exam conducted by the Department of Biotechnology, held annually in June. Candidates must have a valid GATE or NET score to apply.

Apply online for the DBT-JRF program: After qualifying in BET, create an account on the DBT website, fill in the required details, and upload the necessary documents. The application window is typically open from July to August.
Appear for the interview: Shortlisted candidates will attend an interview based on their research proposal and knowledge of biotechnology and life sciences.
Check the final selection list: The final selection list will be announced online on the DBT website a few weeks after the interview.

Scheme Name: Scholarships to Students with Disabilities Scheme
Description: The scheme, initiated by the Department of Social Security and Women & Child Development, Government of Punjab in 1996, aims to assist students with disabilities in securing education, academic, technical, or professional training to help them earn a living and integrate as contributing members of society. It is fully state-sponsored.
Eligibility: 1. Applicant must be a student in Punjab with a disability of 40% or more (as per the RPwD Act 2016). 2. The monthly family/guardian income should not exceed ₹5,000/- per month. 3. The candidate should have secured at least 40% marks in the previous annual examination. 4. Applicable for students with disabilities from 1st class onwards.
Benefits: 1. ₹200/- per month for students with disabilities from class 1 to 8. 2. ₹300/- per month for students with disabilities from class 9 and onwards. Note: The scholarship will be credited directly to the student's bank account.
Required Documents: 1. Disability Certificate/ UDID showing 40% or more disability. 2. Income certificate showing annual family income below ₹60,000/-. 3. Copy of bank account details.

Steps: Submit the scholarship application to the Head of the school/college/institution.
The Head of the institution verifies the application and forwards it to the District Social Security Officer (DSSO) of the respective district.
Application Process.Contact: Office of the District Social Security Officer

Scheme Name: Stipend to Scheduled Caste Trainees in Technical Training Institutions
Description: This scheme, implemented by the Adi Dravidar Welfare and Scheduled Tribes Welfare Department, Union Territory of Puducherry, provides financial support to Scheduled Tribe candidates/trainees undergoing training in Government Technical Training Institutions within the Union Territory of Puducherry.
Eligibility: 1. Candidates/trainees undergoing training in the Government Technical Training Institutions of Puducherry. 2. The candidate must belong to the Scheduled Caste community. 3. There is no income limit to apply under the scheme.
Benefits: 1. A stipend of ₹170/- per month per trainee for the entire duration of the training.
Required Documents: 1. Identity proof (Aadhaar Card). 2. Passport size photograph. 3. Educational documents (Mark sheets). 4. Caste certificate. 5. Nativity Certificate issued by the Competent Revenue Officials. 6. Bank account details. 7. Any other document, as required.

Steps: Step 1: Register on the NSP Portal (https://scholarships.gov.in/) by providing accurate information.
Step 2: After registration, students receive a 'Student Registration ID'.
Step 3: Login using 'Student Registration ID' and click 'Fresh Application'.
Step 4: Fill out the application form and click 'Final Submit'.
Step 5: After submission, a system-generated registration number is sent to students for future reference.

Scheme Name: Post Graduate Indira Gandhi Scholarship For Single Girl Child
Description: A scholarship scheme by the University Grants Commission (UGC) for girl students admitted to the first year of PG courses in any designated university or postgraduate college, provided they are the only girl child in their family. The scheme aims to support the postgraduate education of single girl children and promote the value of small family norms.
Eligibility: 1. The applicant must be a citizen of India. 2. The applicant must be the only girl child in the family. 3. Girl students without brothers or who are twin/fraternal daughters may apply. 4. The age of the applicant should not exceed 30 years at the time of admission to the first year of the PG course. 5. The applicant must have taken admission to a regular, full-time first-year Master’s Degree course in a designated university or postgraduate college. 6. The course must be non-professional, and the student must attend regular classes. 7. Students pursuing education through distance mode are not eligible.
Exclusions: 1. Admission to PG courses via distance education is excluded. 2. Deemed universities not receiving funds from the Central/State Government are not eligible institutions. 3. If a family has both a son and a daughter, the daughter will not be considered for the scholarship.
Benefits: 1. ₹36,200/- per annum for two years, i.e., the full duration of the PG course. 2. 3,000 fresh scholarships are awarded annually and disbursed through DBT mode.

By Student: Proof of admission into a recognized Master’s degree course in an institute located in India recognized by the UGC.
Affidavit regarding single girl child status (Annexure-II format).
By Institution: Progress Report after completion of the first year along with the percentage of marks obtained.
Funds Utilization Certificate after completion of the first year.

Steps: Step 1: Eligible candidates must apply online on the National Scholarship Portal (NSP) after initiation of the application process and notice on the UGC website.
Step 2: The host institution must verify the online application.
Step 3: Institutions admitting first-year PG girl students are expected not to charge tuition fees.
Notes: Applications will be invited annually via the National e-Scholarship Portal.
Notifications will also be uploaded on the UGC website.
Incomplete applications will be rejected, and only verified applications will be considered.
Affidavit regarding single girl child status and joining report must be uploaded as per specified formats.

Scheme Name: Award of Opportunity Cost to Parents of Scheduled Caste Girl Students
Description: Implemented by the Adi Dravidar Welfare Department, Government of Puducherry, this scheme aims to financially assist Scheduled Caste parents for sending their daughters to school. It provides opportunity cost compensation to eliminate child labor and encourage education among Scheduled Caste girl students.
Objective: To eliminate Scheduled Caste girl child labor and encourage Scheduled Caste parents to send their girl children to educational institutions by compensating for income shortages.
Eligibility: 1. The student must be a girl studying in Class VI to XII in a Government or Government-recognized institution in Puducherry. 2. The student must belong to the Scheduled Caste community. 3. The girl student and her parent/guardian must be a native of Puducherry by birth or continuous residence for at least 3 years. 4. The annual income of the parents should not exceed ₹24,000. 5. Opportunity cost is payable only if the girl student has been promoted to the next higher class.
Benefits: ₹3,000/- per academic year is payable to the parents of Scheduled Caste girls studying in Classes VI to XII. This amount is provided in addition to the Pre-Matric Scholarship. The opportunity cost is not payable for re-admitted girls repeating a class due to failure or discontinuance.
Required Documents: Residence-cum-nativity certificate issued by the competent authority

Steps: Step 01: Register on the NSP Portal (https://scholarships.gov.in/) by selecting 'New Registration' and providing accurate information.
Step 02: Obtain a 'Student Registration ID' upon successful registration.
Step 03: Log in using the 'Student Registration ID' through the 'Fresh Application' option on the NSP Portal.
Step 04: Access the application form by clicking on the 'Application Form' icon after login.
Step 05: Complete the application form and click 'Final Submit' to submit it.
Step 06: Upon submission, a system-generated registration number is provided for future reference.

Scheme Name: India-Afghanistan Fellowship Programme
Description: Started in 2010-11, the India-Afghanistan Fellowship Programme supports agricultural human resource development in Afghanistan. It offers fellowships for Afghan nationals to pursue Bachelor's, Master's, and Ph.D. degrees in Indian Agricultural Universities (AUs) in agriculture and allied sciences.
Objective: To enhance agricultural human resource development in Afghanistan through formal education and training of Afghan scientists, faculty, and students in India.

Eligibility.General Requirement: Good knowledge of English for all programmes.

Bachelor's Degree Programme.Academic Qualification: Passed 10+2 examination with Physics, Chemistry, and Biology/Mathematics or both.

Master's Degree Programme.Academic Qualification: Four-year Bachelor's degree in agriculture or related subjects.
Additional Requirements: For M.V.Sc.: Passed B.V.Sc. & A.H. with internship under a 5-year degree programme.
For M.Tech.: Passed B.Tech. or B.E. programme.
Minimum OGPA: 5.50/10 or equivalent percentage of marks at the Bachelor's degree level.

Doctoral Programme.Academic Qualification: Master's degree in the respective or related subject.
Doctoral Programme.Minimum OGPA: 6.5/10 or equivalent percentage of marks at the Master's degree level.

Fellowship Amount.Bachelor's Degree: INR 12,000 per month for four years.
Fellowship Amount.Master's Degree: INR 12,000 per month for two years.
Fellowship Amount.Ph.D. Programme: INR 15,000 per month for three years.

Other Benefits: Provision of research contingency grant: INR 6,000/year for M.Sc. and INR 10,000/year for Ph.D.
Annual bench fee (USD $2000 per year) covered under the India-Afghanistan Fund.
Benefits.Expenditure Coverage: Tuition fees, hostel fees, mess, medical, and travel within India are covered using the consolidated fellowship amount.

Steps: Afghan nationals apply through their government for sponsorship.
Nominations are sent to the Indian Ministry of External Affairs via the Afghan Embassy.
MEA forwards applications to DARE, Government of India.
DARE sends applications to ICAR for eligibility verification and recommendations.
Selected candidates are notified by the respective Indian Agricultural Universities.

Documents Required: Original academic qualification documents for verification.
These documents may need to be deposited with the university and are returned upon course completion.

Scheme Name: Young Interns Program (YIP)
Description: An internship program by the Government of Rajasthan providing opportunities for youth to gain practical experience in government programs, schemes, and projects.
Eligibility: Applicants aged 21 to 30 with postgraduate qualifications (minimum 60% marks) or graduates in Engineering, Medical, Law, CA, or CS streams with minimum 60% marks.
Benefits: ₹30,000 per month stipend, ₹2,500 per month for laptop and internet support, 12 casual leaves annually.
Required Documents: Photograph, Letter of Intent, Domicile Certificate of Rajasthan, Proof of Age, Educational Qualification Certificates, Proof of Experience (if any), Bank Account Details
Exclusions: The internship is temporary with no assurance of permanent employment. Misconduct, unsatisfactory performance, or earning remuneration during the internship may result in termination. Interns must submit an internship report upon resignation or face recovery of the stipend.

Scheme Name: Technology Development & Utilization Programme for Women (TDUPW)
Description: A program by DSIR to promote technology development, utilization, and capability building specifically for women.

For Projects: Studies/surveys for assessing technology-related information needs of women.
Documentation and content development on technologies beneficial to women, including food processing, water conservation, health, and hygiene.
Establishing consultancy cells for imparting technical knowledge.
Awareness creation and training for women in production activities and community management.
Case studies of successful R&D, technology development, and businesswomen.
For Institutions: Organizations in the government, non-government, or professional sectors working on women's technology development.

Institutions receiving annual grants from central/state government agencies, universities, R&D institutions, public sector undertakings, or registered under the Societies Registration Act, Companies Act, or Indian Trusts Act.

Benefits.Duration: Time-bound projects, typically under two years.
Quantum of Financial Assistance: Financial support (partial or full) for expenses such as manpower, consumables, travel within the country, and miscellaneous expenditures.
Assistance excludes infrastructure and building costs.
Benefits.Release of Funds: Released in instalments based on milestones achieved and formalities like progress reports and utilization certificates.

Required Documents: Letter of forwarding the project proposal and undertaking from the institution head.
Certificate of Responsibility and Commitment from Investigators.
Technical and financial details of the proposal.
For non-government institutions: Registration Certificate, Annual Report (last 3 years), Auditor’s Report (last 3 years).

Offline Process.Submission: Send hard copy of proposals to Dr. Sujata Chaklanobis, Scientist 'G', DSIR, Technology Bhawan, New Mehrauli Road, New Delhi-110016.
Offline Process.Evaluation and Sanction: Proposals reviewed by a Technical Advisory Committee (TAC) with potential advice from internal/external experts. Accepted projects receive financial approval and a sanction letter with conditions.

Online Process.Submission: Submit applications online through the Rajasthan Single Sign-On (SSO) Portal.
Steps: Login to the SSO Portal and fill out the application form.
Upload required documents including photograph, Letter of Intent, proof of age, educational qualifications, and experience.
Submit the application after reviewing the information.
Online Process.Evaluation and Sanction: Applications are scrutinized by respective departments. Eligible candidates are invited for Group Discussion (G.D.) and Personal Interview (P.I.).

Scheme Name: Top Class Education For Students With Disabilities
Description: A scholarship scheme by DoEPwDs for Students with Disabilities (SwDs) pursuing studies beyond class 12th in a full-time course in notified institutions. It aims to support SwDs in pursuing higher education and achieving a dignified place in society.

Student: Admitted in a full-time course in a notified institution.
Percentage of disability should be 40% or above.
Pursuing a Graduate or Post Graduate Degree or Diploma.
Total annual income of Parent/Guardian should be ≤ ₹6.00 Lakh.
Not more than two children with disabilities in the same family can avail of the scholarship.

Benefits.Tuition Fee: Full tuition fee and non-refundable charges (Ceiling of Rs. 2.00 LPA per student for private institutions).
Benefits.Special Allowance: ₹ 2000 per month (related to disability types like Reader, Escort, Helper Allowance, etc.).

For Hearing Impaired: Cell phone with SMS SIM Card

Exclusions: Not more than two children with disabilities from the same parents can avail the scholarship. In case the second child is a twin, both can receive the scholarship.
Scholarship will be cancelled if obtained through false statements, and the student will be blacklisted for future schemes.
If the student changes the course of study, the scholarship will be invalid unless approved by DEPwD.
No scholarship will be given for a repeated class.

Steps: Step 1: Prepare soft copies of the required documents. Visit http://www.scholarships.gov.in/ and click 'New Registration'. Accept the terms and click 'Continue'.
Step 2: Complete the Registration Form, providing all mandatory details. Your Application ID and password will be displayed and sent via SMS.
Step 3: Login to the portal using your Application ID and password. Enter OTP for password reset and access the Applicant's Dashboard.
Step 4: Click 'Application Form' on the left pane, fill out all mandatory details, and upload the necessary documents. Save as Draft or click 'Final Submit' to complete the application.

Documents Required: Self-attested Degree/Mark Sheet of the last qualifying exam
Fee Receipt of Current Course Year
Bank Details of the applicant or of the Parent/Guardian
Bonafide Student Certificate from the school/institute
Recent color photograph of the candidate
Certificate of Disability (issued by a competent authority)
Declaration Certificate (issued by HoD or competent authority)

Scheme Name: Innovation In Science Pursuit For Inspired Research (INSPIRE) Fellowship
Description: The INSPIRE Fellowship is part of the INSPIRE scheme by the Department of Science and Technology (DST), Government of India, aimed at attracting students to pursue doctoral degrees in basic and applied sciences, including engineering, medicine, agriculture, veterinary sciences, and pharmacy.

Benefits.Duration: Up to five years from the Effective Date or completion of the Ph.D. program, whichever is earlier.
Benefits.HRA: Applicable as per GoI norms depending on the location of the Host Institute.
Benefits.Contingency Expenditure: ₹20,000 per annum with a maximum ceiling of ₹20,000 for the unspent balance adjusted to the next year.
Benefits.Internship: Short-term Research Internship (up to 18 months) at any national or international lab/university/institute during the 5-year tenure.
Benefits.Upgradation: Fellowship can be upgraded from JRF to SRF after 2 years, or 1 year if research paper acceptance is received.
Benefits.Payment Mode: Transferred through PFMS to the student’s host institute’s ZBSA Bank Account, which then transfers the fellowship to the student's account.

Primary Eligibility: 1st Rank Holders in any recognized University/Institution in PG level examinations in Basic/Applied Sciences, Engineering, Pharmacy, Agricultural Sciences, Veterinary Sciences.
1st Rank Holders in Medicine at Graduate/Post-Graduate level conducted by an Indian University/Institution.
INSPIRE Scholars with at least 70% marks (or CGPA equivalent) in M.Sc./Integrated M.S./M.Sc. or equivalent.
Additional Notes: Fulfilling eligibility criteria does not guarantee final fellowship award.
Selection based on academic merit, research proposal, supervisor’s credentials, and host institution.

Conditions: Update DST on research progress during the fellowship.
Fellow may assist host institution with academic activities, but research should remain the primary focus.
Research work must be completed within the 5-year tenure to meet research objectives.
Acknowledge DST's support in all publications, patents, and the Ph.D. thesis.
Submit soft copies of publications and thesis to DST.

Exclusions: 1st Rank Holders from College/Autonomous College Examinations.
Students with degrees obtained through Distance Education Mode.
1st Rank Holders in M.Sc. 2nd year/last year.
Students receiving multiple fellowships concurrently.
Termination Conditions: Non-acceptance of Final Offer within 30 days.
Successful Ph.D. viva-voce or completion of 5 years of fellowship.
Resignation from the fellowship based on supervisor's recommendation and DST's acceptance.
Change of host institution without DST approval.

Steps: Step 1: Log in with your registered email ID and password.
Step 2: Click on 'Fellowship' link and then 'Apply for Fellowship'.
Step 3: Fill out personal details, educational qualifications, eligibility, and Ph.D. enrollment details.
Step 4: Agree to the declaration, enter CAPTCHA, and click 'Submit'.
Step 5: Note your reference number for future communication.
Application Process.Selection Process: Two-tier selection process: internal screening followed by expert committee review. Final selection is expected within 6 months from application submission.

Documents Required: Mark sheets for educational qualifications (12th Std., UG & PG Program)
First Rank Certificate (if not an INSPIRE Scholar)
Ph.D. Admission Letter (if enrolled in Ph.D.)
No Objection Certificate (NOC) for change of host institution

Special Conditions.Internship: Report, joining letter, and financial statement required after internship.
Completion of Fellowship: Statement of Expenditure (SE) and Utilization Certificate (UC) for the fellowship duration.
Unspent balance receipt (if any) to be remitted to the Consolidated Fund of India.

Scheme Name: Pre Matric Scholarship for Students with Disabilities
Description: This scholarship is for students with disabilities studying in Class 9th or 10th in a government-recognized school. The scheme is aimed at providing financial support to students with disabilities to continue their education and find opportunities for a dignified life.

Eligibility.Age & Class: The applicant must be studying in Class 9th or 10th.
Eligibility.Disability: The applicant must have a disability of 40% or more.
Eligibility.Income Limit: The total annual income of the parents/guardians should not exceed ₹2.00 Lakh.
Eligibility.Exclusivity: The applicant must not be availing of any other government scholarship, and must not be the third sibling receiving this scholarship.

Exclusions: Scholarship will not be given to more than two students from a family.
A student cannot hold any other scholarship or stipend.
If false information/documents are provided, the scholarship will be revoked and recovery will be made with 15% compound interest.
If a student repeats a class, no scholarship will be granted for that class.

Steps: Step 1: Go to http://www.scholarships.gov.in/ and click 'New Registration'. Read the guidelines and accept the terms. Click 'Continue'.
Step 2: Fill in the Registration Form, ensuring all compulsory fields are completed. Click 'Register'. A confirmation will be sent with your Application ID and password.
Step 3: Go to https://scholarships.gov.in/fresh/newstdRegfrmInstruction and click 'Login to Apply'. Enter your Application ID and password, and complete the OTP verification.

Step 4: Fill in the application form by entering the necessary details and uploading the required documents. Click 'Save as Draft' if you want to complete it later, or 'Final Submit' to submit your application.

Documents Required: Certificate of Disability (issued by the competent authority)
Bank Details (of the applicant or Parent/Guardian)
Institution Registration: The institution where the applicant is studying must also register at the National Scholarship Portal (NSP) and verify the candidate's details.

Scheme Name: Prime Minister’s Scholarship Scheme (PMSS) for Railway Protection Force (RPF)
Description: Introduced by the Hon’ble Prime Minister of India in 2005 and implemented from 2008-09, the PMSS is aimed at encouraging higher technical and professional education for the dependent wards of Ex/Serving RPF/RPSF personnel and widows (below the rank of Gazetted officer).

Benefits.Special Letter: Letter from the Hon’ble Prime Minister
Benefits.Duration: Two to five years as per the duration of the course

Eligibility.Applicants: Dependent wards of Ex/Serving RPF/RPSF personnel and widows (below the rank of Gazetted officer).
Eligibility.Course Limitations: Only regular courses from institutes/universities/colleges with AISHE recognition. No distance learning courses.
Courses Eligible: Other Government Recognized Professional Degree Courses
Eligibility.Nationality: Students studying abroad are not eligible.

Order of Preference: Category I: Wards/widows of ex-RPF/RPSF personnel who died in encounters with terrorists or criminals or during election work.
Category II: Wards/widows of ex-RPF/RPSF personnel who died while in service.
Category III: Wards of ex-RPF/RPSF (retired) personnel.
Category IV: Wards of serving RPF/RPSF personnel.

Steps: Step 1: Go to the National Scholarship Portal and select 'Central Schemes' > 'Ministry of Railway'.
Step 2: Register as a new user by filling in the Registration Form.
Step 3: After registration, login using the Student Registration ID.
Step 4: Complete the application form and submit.
Step 5: On successful submission, a system-generated registration number will be sent.
Post-Application Process: Zonal Railways verify the applications for eligibility.
Scholarship amounts are credited to the applicant's bank account via PFMS under the DBT system.

For Fresh Applicants: Service Certificate from respective offices (Category IV).
For Renewal Applicants: Latest Service Certificate from respective offices (Category IV).
Previous class mark sheet/Grade card/Proof of gradation.

Important Notes: Maximum of two registrations can be made with a single mobile number.
The college/institute/university must be AISHE registered.
Scholarship will be credited via the Direct Benefit Transfer (DBT) system.

Scheme Name: Free Education for Sports Medal Winners / Participants of National/International Events
Description: This scheme provides financial assistance to medal winners and elite sports persons who participate in national or international sporting events and are studying in full-time regular courses at recognized universities/colleges. The objective is to motivate sports persons to achieve higher levels of performance by assisting them financially for education and sports development.
Aims and Objectives: Provide financial assistance to medal winners and elite sports persons studying in Universities/Colleges offering full-time regular courses.
Motivate sports persons to achieve higher levels of performance in both education and sports.

Eligibility.Eligible Candidates: Medal winners in national games or participants in recognized international sporting events.
Institutions: Universities/Institutions/Colleges under sections 2(f) and 12(b) of the UGC Act, 1956.
Deemed to be Universities under section 3 of the UGC Act, 1956.
Eligibility.Subsequent Eligibility: Scholarship eligibility in subsequent years depends on the student’s performance in both sports and academics.

Exclusions: Misconduct by the candidate as reported by the University/College/Institution.
Unsatisfactory progress in academics, such as frequent failures in examinations.

Olympics/World Championships (more than.Allowances for Special Courses Abroad: As per Government of India’s norms

Olympics/World Championships (less than.Allowances for Special Courses Abroad: As per Government of India’s norms

Asian Championships, World University Ga.Allowances for Special Courses Abroad: As per Government of India’s norms

National Level Competitions, SAF Games.Allowances for Special Courses Abroad: As per Government of India’s norms

Steps: Step 1: Visit the online portal at 'http://www.ugc.ac.in/page/XII-Plan-Guidelines.aspx'.
Step 2: Submit an online application and upload a certificate of participation/medal winner attested by Registrar/Principal/Director.
Step 3: The amount will be reimbursed by UGC through the Direct Benefit Transfer (DBT) mode.
Application Process.Note: Incomplete applications will not be considered. Candidates must apply strictly as per the instructions provided on the online portal.

By Candidate: Application in the prescribed format for the scholarship.
Certificate of participation/medal winner attested by Registrar/Principal.
By University/College/Institution: Statement with names of selected students and receipt of scholarship amount.
Progress Report after completion of the first year in terms of sports performance and academics.
Utilization certificate for previous grant released.
Certificate from the Director/Head of Department justifying the continuance of the scholarship, forwarded by Registrar/Principal.

Cancellation of Scholarship: Misconduct or failure in exams can lead to the termination of the scholarship.
The decision of the UGC in terminating the scholarship is final and binding.

Scheme Name: Indian Agricultural Research Institute - Scholarship
Description: The scholarship provides financial support to students enrolled in M.Sc. and Ph.D. courses at the Indian Agricultural Research Institute (IARI). The awards are based on merit and performance at the Post Graduate School, with a duration of up to two years for M.Sc. students and three years for Ph.D. students. Extensions may be granted in exceptional cases.

M.Sc. Course.Extension: Up to 3 months with exceptional justification

Ph.D. Course.Extension: Up to 6 months with exceptional justification

M.Sc./M.Tech. (Agricultural Engineering).Educational Qualification: Bachelor's degree under 10+2+4, 10+2+3, or 10+1+4 system. B.Sc. degree under 10+2+2 system prior to 1985.

Ph.D. Courses.Minimum Marks Required: 60% or OGPA of 7.50 out of 10 for General/OBC candidates, 55% or OGPA of 7.00 out of 10 for SC/ST/PC candidates.

General Eligibility.Nationality: Indian nationals or persons domiciled in India
General Eligibility.Age Limit: Minimum age for Ph.D. admission: 21 years as of 31st July of the year of admission
General Eligibility.Other Criteria: Fellows must devote full time to study and cannot hold another paid or unpaid appointment.

In-Service Candidates.Stipend Adjustment: Scholarship amount adjusted to ₹3,000 per month in addition to full leave salary for in-service candidates on study leave.

Steps: Step 1: Request application form and Information Bulletin by sending a crossed Demand Draft for ₹575 (or ₹500 for SC/ST/PC candidates) to the Registrar, Post Graduate School, IARI.
Step 2: Alternatively, purchase the application form and Information Bulletin at Syndicate Bank, Pusa Campus for ₹500 (₹250 for SC/ST/PC candidates).
Step 3: Alternatively, download the application form from the IARI website and send it with the appropriate Demand Draft.
Step 4: Employed candidates must submit their application through their employer.
Application Process.Contact Information: Registrar, Post Graduate School, Indian Agricultural Research Institute, New Delhi 110 012

Documents Required: Higher Secondary (12th) certificate and mark sheet (if applicable)
Bachelor's degree certificate and mark sheet
Master's degree certificate and mark sheet (for Ph.D. applicants)

Scheme Name: Scholarship to 2 Years Pre-Service Student Teachers undergoing D.El.Ed Programme at DIETs and CTTC Sohra
Description: Launched by the Department of Education, Government of Meghalaya in April 2012, this scholarship aims to attract the best talent to pursue teaching as a profession. It provides financial support to students undertaking the D.El.Ed programme at DIETs and CTTC Sohra, with a focus on improving the quality of education in rural areas.
Objectives: To attract the best talent to take up teaching as a profession.
To provide high-quality education services to students in rural areas.
To enhance students' learning outcomes by addressing specific workforce needs.
To provide additional resources to DIETs for areas not covered by the Central Sponsored Scheme (CSS).

Structure of Entrance Test.Format: Written examination consisting of multiple choice questions.
Details: No negative marking for incorrect answers.
Aptitude towards the teaching profession will be tested.

Eligibility.Age Limit: 18 to 27 years (Relaxation of 5 years for SC/ST/OBC/PWD candidates).

Educational Qualifications.Class XII: Passed or equivalent examination with 50% marks (5% relaxation for ST/SC/OBC/PWD).
Educational Qualifications.Waiting for Results: Candidates awaiting Class XII results can apply, with the condition to produce provisional/original documents during counseling.

Eligibility.Other Criteria: Must be interested in becoming a teacher.

Reservation Policy.General: As per Meghalaya Government Reservation Policy for different communities.
Reservation Policy.Science & Mathematics Background: At least 30% of seats allotted to candidates with Science and Mathematics backgrounds at Class XII level.

Selection Procedure.3: Merit-based selection as per block quota
Selection Procedure.Note: Preference to be given to the waiting list from other districts if the number of selected candidates is less than the intake capacity.

Steps: Step 1: Register on the NSP Portal (https://scholarships.gov.in/) using 'New Registration' and provide accurate information.
Step 2: After successful registration, note the 'Student Registration ID'.
Step 3: Login to the NSP Portal using 'Student Registration ID' and select 'Fresh Application'.
Step 4: Fill out the application form and click 'Final Submit'.
Step 5: After submission, a system-generated registration number will be sent for future reference.

Note: Selected candidates must open an account at the State Bank of India in the districts they are selected for.

Scheme Name: Internship Scheme For PG/Research Students In Directorate General Of Trade Remedies (DGTR)
Description: The Internship Scheme by the Directorate General of Trade Remedies (DGTR), Department of Commerce, Ministry of Commerce & Industry, provides an opportunity for young scholars, especially from Law/Economics streams, to learn about trade remedial investigations and trade defence measures.
Objectives: To familiarize PG students and research scholars with trade remedial investigations.
To provide exposure to trade defense measures.

Nature of Internship.Mentorship: Interns will be attached to one officer at DGTR who will act as a mentor and design a suitable schedule.
Nature of Internship.Departments: Interns may be assigned to different Officers, Divisions, or Cells based on the mentor's recommendation and DGTR's discretion.

Number of Interns: The number of interns will be decided by DGTR.

Internship Terms.Job Guarantee: Internship is not a job and does not guarantee employment within DGTR, the Department, or the Government.
Internship Terms.Termination: DGTR reserves the right to terminate the internship at any time without providing a reason.

Benefits.Certificate of Internship: Interns will receive a certificate after the successful completion of their internship.

Stipend: No financial aid or stipend will be provided by DGTR.

Eligibility.Student Status: Applicants must be Postgraduate Students or Research Scholars from a recognized University/Institute.
Eligibility.Course Requirement: The internship must be a part of the applicant's course curriculum (may extend to a semester) or an additional assignment during annual vacations.

Steps: Offline: Interested students should send their application in the prescribed proforma along with their CV (optional) by post or by hand to the General Administration Section, Directorate General of Trade Remedies (DGTR), Ministry of Commerce, Jeevan Tara Building, New Delhi 110001. Applications should be sent at least one month before the intended start date of the internship.

Online: Interested students may email their application in the prescribed proforma along with their CV (optional) to dgtr-india@gov.in. Applications should be sent at least one month before the intended start date of the internship.

At the Time of Application: Permission/forwarding letter from the Supervisor or Head of Department of the Institute.
At the Time of Completion: A brief report/paper summarizing the internship assignment must be presented at the end of the internship.

Scheme Name: Internship Scheme of the Department of Economic Affairs
Description: The Department of Economic Affairs offers an internship program to postgraduate and PhD students specializing in Economics, Law, Finance, and Management. The aim is to familiarize students with the process of formulating economic policies at the macro level and to provide them with an opportunity to research specific economic issues such as macro-economic management, capital markets, inflation management, and fiscal policy.
Eligibility: The program is open to outstanding candidates pursuing Post Graduation or PhD in Economics, Law, Finance, or Management from universities or institutions ranked within the top 25 according to the National Institutional Ranking Framework (NIRF) or from QS-ranked international universities.

Benefits.Remuneration: A token remuneration of ₹10,000 per month for postgraduate students and ₹20,000 per month for PhD students is provided on satisfactory completion of the internship and submission of the final report/paper.
Benefits.Logistics Support: Interns are provided with necessary office space, computer facilities, and internet access to assist in their research and work.
Benefits.Certificate: A Certificate of Internship is issued to interns on the successful completion of the internship, which includes submission of a report/paper, feedback, and attendance certified by the Divisional Head.

Duration: The internship duration is between 3 to 6 months. Due to the short time frame, interns are expected to conduct intense research to achieve the desired results.

Slots.Paid Internships: A maximum of 15 paid internships are available.
Slots.Unpaid Internships: An additional 10 unpaid internships are available for top-ranking candidates who were not selected for paid positions.

Attachment: Interns are attached to a Joint Secretary, Director, Office of Chief Economic Adviser, or Principal Economic Adviser. They will work under the guidance of a mentor who will provide them with a structured schedule and tasks.

Post-Selection Conditions.Unsatisfactory Performance: Interns who demonstrate unsatisfactory performance may be relieved from the program prematurely.
Post-Selection Conditions.No Job Assurance: The internship is not a job guarantee, nor does it offer any assurance of permanent employment in the Department of Economic Affairs.

Exclusions: This internship program is not available to undergraduate or graduate students outside the specified fields of study.

Application Process.Step 1: Candidates must register on the MoF-DEA Internship Application Link provided by the Ministry of Finance.
Application Process.Step 2: In the application form, candidates need to provide their area of interest, duration of availability, and three divisions of interest, in order of preference.
Application Process.Step 3: Applications should be submitted only through the web portal; email applications will not be considered.

Required Documents: Proof of identity (e.g., Aadhar card or passport)
Proof of address (e.g., utility bill or bank statement)
Proof of the latest educational qualification (degree, mark sheets)
Identity card or proof of enrolment in the postgraduate or PhD program
Letter of recommendation from the institution
Bank account details for payment of stipend

Scheme Name: ICAR - Post Matric Scholarship For Scheduled Caste / Scheduled Tribes Candidates
Description: The Post-Matric Scholarship scheme by the Indian Council of Agricultural Research (ICAR) aims to support students from Scheduled Castes (SC) and Scheduled Tribes (ST) communities to pursue undergraduate courses in Agriculture and Allied Sciences. The scholarship helps these students complete their Bachelor's Degree programs, including B.Sc.(Agri.), B.V.Sc., B.Sc.(Agril. Engg.), and more.
Eligibility: The scholarship is exclusively for SC/ST students, as defined by the Government of India, who have been admitted to Agricultural Universities for any undergraduate degree program in Agriculture and Allied Sciences.

Benefits.Contingent Grant: ₹750 per annum for tuition fees, purchase of books, uniforms, etc.
Benefits.Duration: The scholarship covers the entire normal duration of the specific degree program.

Application Process.Step 1: The scholarship and contingent grant amounts will be remitted to the respective agricultural universities on demand, through the Registrar or Comptroller in the prescribed proforma: https://education.icar.gov.in/pdf/format-PMS-2017.pdf
Application Process.Step 2: The scholarship will be disbursed from the date of the student's admission to the course.

Procedure of Selection.Tentative Distribution: The scholarships will be tentatively allocated to agricultural universities based on the seats reserved for SC/ST candidates.
Procedure of Selection.Final Allotment: The actual number of scholarships will be decided based on the number of SC/ST students admitted to each university to ensure equitable distribution.

Documents Required: Details of Aadhaar linked bank account
Marksheets of the previous qualified examination

Scheme Name: Pre-Matric Scholarship
Description: The Pre-Matric Scholarship scheme aims to improve the educational status of students from Other Backward Classes (OBC) in Uttar Pradesh. The scheme provides financial support to OBC students studying in government schools, aided, and recognized educational institutes to encourage their education and reduce dropout rates.
Eligibility: The applicant must be a native of Uttar Pradesh, with an annual income of their parents/guardians up to ₹2 Lakh. The student must be enrolled in government schools, aided, or recognized educational institutes, subject to budget availability.

Benefits.Monthly Scholarship: ₹150 per month for a maximum of 10 months
Benefits.Annual Grant: ₹750 as an ad-hoc grant in one go

Application Process.Step 1: OBC students need to log in to the website and click on the 'Student Section'.
Application Process.Step 2: Complete the student registration and fill out the application form.
Application Process.Step 3: Print the application form and submit it along with all required documents to the educational institute.
Application Process.Step 4: The educational institute will verify and forward the application.
Application Process.Step 5: The Education Officer will verify and forward the application.
Application Process.Step 6: The state NIC will examine and match the data.
Application Process.Step 7: The District Approval Committee will approve or disapprove the application.
Application Process.Step 8: The District Backward Class Welfare Officer will lock the approved data using a digital signature.
Application Process.Step 9: The Directorate will generate the demand based on the approved data.
Application Process.Step 10: The scholarship amount will be directly deposited into the student’s bank account.

Documents Required: UP Residential Proof (Ration card, Aadhaar card, Voter ID, Driving license, or PAN card)
Student ID proof issued by the educational institution
Current year fee receipt or admission letter issued by the educational institution

Scheme Name: MeitY - Visvesvaraya PhD Scheme For Electronics & IT
Description: A scholarship scheme by the Ministry of Electronics and Information Technology to enhance the number of PhDs in Electronics System Design & Manufacturing (ESDM) and IT/ITES sectors in the country.
Eligibility: Applicants must have a minimum Grade Point Average of 6.5/10 or 60% in M.E./M.Tech./M.S. or equivalent in relevant fields, or a Bachelor's degree with a valid GATE score or equivalent.

Full-Time Ph.D. Candidates.Fellowship: ₹31,500/month (I & II years); ₹35,000/month (III to V year), revised to ₹38,750/month (I & II years); ₹43,750/month (III to V year)
Full-Time Ph.D. Candidates.Rent Reimbursement: Up to 30%, 20%, or 10% of the fellowship for different city classifications (X, Y, Z cities)

Part-Time Ph.D. Candidates.Incentive: ₹2,50,000 on successful completion of the Ph.D.

Young Faculty Research Fellowship (YFRF).Contingency/Research Grant: ₹5,00,000/year for research expenses and conference support

Application Process: The applicant must print the application form from the institute's website, fill in the required details, attach necessary documents, and email the completed form to the Nodal Officer of the institute.
Documents Required: No Objection Certificate from employer (if part-time/external)

Scheme Name: ICAR Post Matric Scholarship For Scheduled Caste / Scheduled Tribes Candidates
Description: A scholarship scheme by the Indian Council of Agricultural Research (ICAR) for Scheduled Castes/Scheduled Tribes candidates to study at Bachelor's Degree programs in various branches of Agriculture.
Eligibility: Applicant must be an Indian citizen belonging to Scheduled Castes/Scheduled Tribes as defined by the Government of India. Must have been admitted to Agricultural Universities in undergraduate Agriculture & Allied Science programs such as B.Sc. (Agri.), B.V.Sc., B.Sc. (Agril. Engg.), B.Sc. (Home Science), B.F.Sc., B.Sc. (Forestry), etc.

Benefits.Value of Scholarship: ₹300 per month along with ₹750 per annum contingent grant for tuition fees, books, uniforms, etc.
Benefits.Duration of Scholarship: The scholarship will cover the normal duration of the degree program.

Exclusions.Other Scholarships: The recipient cannot avail any other scholarship or part-time employment during the scholarship period.
Exclusions.Termination: The scholarship may be terminated if the student is dropped from the institution, fails to maintain academic performance, or is guilty of misconduct.

Application Process: Online application process is currently in progress. Please check the official ICAR website for updates.
Documents Required: Proof of admission to an Agricultural University for an undergraduate degree program in Agriculture & Allied Sciences

Scheme Name: Pre-Matric Scholarships to the Children of Those Engaged in Occupations Involving Cleaning and Prone to Health Hazards
Description: A scholarship scheme by the Department of Social Justice and Empowerment, Ministry of Social Justice and Empowerment, to provide financial assistance to children whose parents/guardians are engaged in hazardous occupations such as tanners, flayers, waste pickers, and manual scavengers.

Categories: Persons engaged in Manual Scavenging (under the Manual Scavengers Act, 2013)
Persons engaged in hazardous cleaning (under the Manual Scavengers Act, 2013)
Eligibility.Conditions: Children must not be employed or assist in parents' work during studies. The scholarship will be discontinued if the student fails to secure annual promotion or violates school discipline.

Additional Provisions for Students with.Reader Allowance: ₹ 100 per month for blind students (Classes III and X)
Additional Provisions for Students with.Transport Allowance: ₹ 50 per month for disabled students not residing in hostels
Additional Provisions for Students with.Special Pay: ₹ 100 per month to a helper for severely handicapped students
Additional Provisions for Students with.Escort Allowance: ₹ 50 per month for severely handicapped day scholars
Additional Provisions for Students with.Extra Coaching Allowance: ₹ 100 per month for mentally retarded/mentally ill students (Classes III and X)

Duration: The scholarship is provided for a maximum of 10 months per academic year, ending at the completion of Class 10th.
Mode of Disbursal: The scholarship is disbursed through Direct Benefit Transfer (DBT) to the students' bank accounts via State Governments/UT Administrations.

Application Process.Announcement: The scheme will be announced by the concerned State Government/UT Administration.
Application Process.Application Forms: Forms will be provided by the respective State Government/UT Department and should be submitted online with supporting documents.
Application Process.Submission: Students should fill out the application form and submit it to the school authority for uploading on the portal.
Application Process.Renewal: The scholarship may be renewed annually by the concerned State Government/UT Administration.

Documents Required: Bank details of the Aadhaar-linked bank account
Certificate from the District Social Welfare Officer or other designated officer proving the parent is engaged in eligible occupations

Scheme Name: Central Sector Scheme of National Fellowship for Providing Fellowship to Scheduled Caste Students to Pursue M.Phil. & PhD
Description: The fellowship scheme was launched in 2005-06 by the Ministry of Social Justice & Empowerment to provide financial assistance to Scheduled Caste (SC) students pursuing M.Phil or Ph.D. in Sciences, Humanities, or Social Sciences from recognized Indian universities.

Eligibility.1: Applicant must belong to the Scheduled Caste (SC) category.
Eligibility.2: Applicant must be pursuing regular and full-time advanced studies/research leading to an M.Phil/PhD degree.
Eligibility.3: Applicant must have qualified one of the following tests: National Eligibility Test - Junior Research Fellowship (NET - JRF) or UGC-CSIR NET-JRF Joint Test.
Eligibility.4: Applicant must be enrolled in a University/Institution recognized by UGC under Section 2(f) or Section 3 of the UGC Act, 1956.
Eligibility.5: The applicant is eligible for only one fellowship at a time and must not accept any other monetary benefit/scholarship/fellowship from any other source.

Number of Slots.Breakdown: 1500 Junior Research Fellowships (JRF) for Humanities/Social Sciences and 500 JRF for Science stream

Fellowship Rates.JRF: ₹31,000 per month for the first two years
Fellowship Rates.SRF: ₹35,000 per month for the remaining tenure

Contingency Allowance.Humanities/Social Sciences: ₹10,000 per annum for JRF and ₹20,500 per annum for SRF
Contingency Allowance.Science: ₹12,000 per annum for JRF and ₹25,000 per annum for SRF

Benefits.Escort/Reader Assistance: ₹2,000 per month for physically and visually handicapped candidates, applicable for both JRF and SRF
Benefits.House Rent Allowance (HRA): 8%, 16%, or 24% depending on the location of the research work, for students not provided with hostel accommodation.

Duration.M.Phil: 2 years maximum with JRF for 2 years (no SRF eligibility)
Duration.Ph.D: 5 years maximum, with JRF for the first 2 years and SRF for the remaining 3 years
Duration.M.Phil + Ph.D: 5 years maximum, with JRF for the first 2 years and SRF for the remaining 3 years

Disbursal Mode: Fellowship is directly credited to the beneficiary's Aadhaar-linked bank account via Direct Benefit Transfer (DBT).

Reservation/Relaxation.SC Students: Preference is given to SC students who have secured admission and qualified the NET examination.
Reservation/Relaxation.PwD (Persons with Disabilities): Inclusive provision as per the Rights of Persons with Disabilities Act, 2016, with a minimum 40% disability required for eligibility for concessions.

Exclusions: University/College/Institution employees, even on study leave, are excluded from the fellowship.
Students who have already availed or partially availed any Ph.D. fellowship are not eligible to apply.

Application Process.Call for Applications: UGC advertises and invites online applications for the fellowship based on the merit of NET/UGC-CSIR NET-JRF examination.
Application Process.Merit List Preparation: Merit list will be prepared based on the NET examination. Preference is given to candidates who have secured admission. In case of insufficient candidates, those who have not yet secured admission will be selected in order of merit.
Application Process.Result Intimation: Results are published on the UGC website, and award letters are available for download from the UGC online portal.

Documents Required: Self-attested degree/mark sheet of the last qualifying exam
Fee receipt for the current course year
Bank details of Aadhaar-linked bank account
Caste certificate issued by competent authority

Scheme Name: NPC Students Internship Program
Description: The National Productivity Council (NPC) offers internship training to undergraduate and postgraduate students, providing exposure to various interventions and IT-enabled activities undertaken by NPC. This program helps students apply their academic knowledge in real-world scenarios, develop new skills, and gain deeper insights into industrial and technological processes.

Benefits.Certificate: Interns will receive an internship completion certificate after submitting the full project report.
Benefits.Logistics & Support: NPC provides working space, internet facilities, and necessary support. Interns must bring their own laptops.
Benefits.Boarding & Lodging: Interns are responsible for their own transportation and accommodation.
Benefits.Remuneration: No financial remuneration or stipend is provided.

Eligibility.1: The applicant must be an Indian citizen.
Eligibility.2: The applicant must not have already applied for the internship in the current financial year.
Eligibility.3: The applicant must be pursuing graduation or post-graduation studies.

Skills Required: Strong editing, written, and oral communication skills.
Proactive technical troubleshooting and problem-solving skills.
Knowledge of learning patterns and research for generating quality learning materials.
Familiarity with current and emerging eLearning tools and applications.
Expertise in graphics creation for training, websites, and classroom-based materials.
Desired Skills: Proficiency in Microsoft Office Suite (Word, Excel, PowerPoint, Outlook), Adobe Photoshop, and/or Adobe InDesign.
Proficiency in graphic design tools like Corel Draw, Illustrator, Ink Shape.
Programming and website development skills with Java, .NET, JavaScript, HTML/DHTML.
Experience with technologies like SAS, Big Data, Hadoop, Hive, Pig, Python, SQL, AI, Machine Learning, Data Annotation Services.

Application Process.Step 1: Submit a filled and signed application form with required documents (self-attested) to the college/institution. Mention the desired internship duration.
Application Process.Step 2: The college/institution sends the application to Director (HRM), National Productivity Council, New Delhi - 110003.

To be Submitted with Application: Letter from Supervisor/Head of Department/Principal, with 'No Objection' Certificate allowing the student to undertake the internship.
To be Submitted at the End of Internship: Project/Assignment report/paper detailing the learning experience.

Scheme Name: Department of Expenditure Internship Programme
Description: The Department of Expenditure offers an internship program for undergraduates, postgraduates, and research scholars to familiarize them with the process of formulating economic policies of the Government of India. This is not a job or a guarantee for a job in the Department.

Duration.Flexible: Internships are available at various times throughout the financial year.

Logistics Support.Declaration of Secrecy: Interns are required to submit a declaration of secrecy before beginning the internship.

Placement.Assigned to: Interns will be attached to DS/Director level officers in various divisions based on their areas of interest and division requirements.

Benefits.Remuneration: ₹10,000 per month, payable on completion of the internship and submission of a report/paper.
Benefits.Certificate: Interns will receive a certificate of internship after successful completion and submission of their report/paper.

General Criteria: Postgraduates in Economics, Finance, Management, or students in the 4th and 5th years of a 5-year integrated Law course or other professional courses.
Specific Criteria: Postgraduate students must have a first-class graduate degree.
Research students must have at least 50% marks in Post-Graduation.
Students in the 4th or 5th year of the 5-year integrated Law course must have at least 80% marks in their 12th-grade examination.

Steps: Submit application form and CV to Section Officer (Admn-I), Department of Expenditure, North Block, New Delhi.
Include a write-up (500 words) on why you consider this program useful for your career.
Required Documents: Write-up on the importance of the program (500 words)

End of Internship Requirements.Report: Submit a report or paper to the Head of the Division on the assigned subject.
End of Internship Requirements.Feedback: Provide feedback on the internship experience, including monitoring and supervision by the concerned Director/JS.

Scheme Name: Maulana Azad National Fellowship For Minority Students
Description: The Maulana Azad National Fellowship for Minority Students was launched in 2009 by the Ministry of Minority Affairs to provide financial aid to students from minority communities to pursue M. Phil and Ph.D. courses at recognized institutions. The fellowship aims to support students from minority communities to further their academic research and higher studies in various fields.
Eligibility: Students from minority communities (Buddhist, Christian, Jain, Muslim, Sikh, or Zoroastrian) who have qualified for the UGC-NET or Joint CSIR-UGC NET examination. The fellowship is available only for students who have not availed of any fellowship earlier. Employees of any educational institution or government are not eligible.
Benefits: The fellowship provides a stipend of ₹31,000 per month for Junior Research Fellowship (JRF) for the first two years, and ₹35,000 per month for Senior Research Fellowship (SRF) for the remaining tenure. Additionally, contingency grants for different streams (Humanities, Social Science, Science, Engineering & Technology) are provided, along with ₹2,000 per month for physically and visually handicapped candidates for escort/reader assistance.
Required Documents: 1. UGC-NET/CSIR-UGC NET Certificate. 2. Continuation Certificate (submitted every three months). 3. Progress Report (submitted after one year of the fellowship). 4. Contingency Grant Account for eligible expenses. 5. HRA Certificate (if applicable). 6. Passport-sized photograph. 7. Write-up (not exceeding 500 words) explaining how the fellowship will contribute to the student's career growth.
Additional Notes: Only two students per family are allowed to benefit from this fellowship. The fellowship is granted for a maximum duration of five years for M. Phil and Ph.D. students. If the research work is not completed during the fellowship period, the student will not be eligible to apply again under this scheme. Employees of universities, colleges, or government institutions are ineligible, even if they are on study leave.

Scheme Name: Innovation In Science Pursuit For Inspired Research (INSPIRE) - Scholarship For Higher Education (SHE)
Description: The INSPIRE Scholarship for Higher Education (SHE) aims to attract students to pursue basic and natural science courses at the undergraduate and postgraduate levels and promote research careers in these fields. The scheme provides scholarships to meritorious students to study in the disciplines of Physics, Chemistry, Biology, Mathematics, and more, under the Department of Science and Technology (DST), Government of India.
Eligibility: Meritorious students with top 1% marks in their Class XII examination or top ranks in JEE, AIPMT, NTSE, KVPY, and other science-related competitions. The student must be pursuing B.Sc., B.S., Int. M.Sc./Int. M.S. in Basic and Natural Sciences at recognized institutions in India.
Benefits: The scholarship provides ₹80,000 per annum, ₹60,000 as a monthly scholarship of ₹5,000 and ₹20,000 as a summer research project grant. The scholarship is transferred directly to the student's SBI account. Students must also undertake a summer research project at a recognized research center.
Required Documents: 1. Class XII Mark Sheet. 2. JEE, AIPMT, NTSE, KVPY, or other competition rank (if applicable). 3. Performance Report from the current institution. 4. Scanned copy of the first page of SBI passbook for bank account details. 5. Any additional certificates supporting eligibility.
Additional Notes: The scholarship is for a maximum period of five years or until the completion of the course. Only Basic and Natural Sciences subjects are supported under this scholarship. The call for applications is advertised on the INSPIRE Web Portal, and the selection process may take up to four months.

Scheme Name: Long Term Fellowship under the Human Resource Development Programme for Health Research
Description: The Long Term Fellowship under the Human Resource Development Programme for Health Research aims to provide advanced training to medical and health research personnel in cutting-edge research areas related to health and medicine. The fellowship targets the creation of a skilled workforce for health research in India, with training opportunities both within India and abroad in priority health research areas.
Eligibility: Indian citizens working in Indian institutes with at least three years of experience as regular faculty. Applicants should have an M.D./M.S./M.D.S. or equivalent degree like MBBS/BDS/MVSc./M.Sc./M.Pharma/M.Tech or Ph.D. in health/medical research. The applicant should be below 45 years of age and should not have availed any government fellowship of one month or more for the same research area.

Long-Term Fellowship in Indian Institute.Stipend: ₹40,000 per month (₹20,000 if training is at the same station)
Long-Term Fellowship in Indian Institute.Contingency Grant: ₹30,000 maximum for local travel and ₹20,000 for attending progress review meetings at DHR
Long-Term Fellowship in Indian Institute.Travel: As per T.A. rules of the parent organization

Long-Term Fellowship Abroad.Stipend: US $3000 per month (or equivalent in other currency)
Long-Term Fellowship Abroad.Air Travel: Cost of air passage in economy class from parent institute to host institute
Long-Term Fellowship Abroad.Contingency Grant: ₹50,000 maximum for local expenses, visa, insurance, and ₹20,000 for attending progress review meetings
Long-Term Fellowship Abroad.Conference Grant: US $600 for up to 6 months or US $1200 for 6-12 months for attending conferences

Application Process.Step 1: Submit full-length research proposals online through the DHR Electronics Project Management System (e-PMS) portal.
Application Process.Step 2: Register and login to the e-PMS portal.
Application Process.Step 3: Complete profile and submit a new proposal under the appropriate sub-scheme.
Application Process.Step 4: Verify email and complete mandatory sections before submission.

Documents Required: Utilization certificate and Statement of expenditure
Additional Notes: The fellowship is for 6-12 months, non-transferable, and the stipend will be disbursed through bank transactions. All documents should be submitted through the online portal, and no hard copies should be sent by post.

Scheme Name: Junior Research Fellowship in Engineering & Technology
Description: The Junior Research Fellowship (JRF) in Engineering & Technology, offered by the University Grants Commission (UGC), is designed for candidates who wish to pursue research leading to a Ph.D. in engineering and technology. This fellowship provides opportunities for M.Pharma, M.E., and M.Tech students through direct interviews conducted by the UGC, as there is no NET examination in these fields.

Eligibility.Qualifications: Candidates must hold an M.E./M.Tech. degree or equivalent with at least 55% marks. GATE is not mandatory for applying for this fellowship.
Eligibility.Age Limit: The age limit is 40 years as of 1st July of the award year, extendable by five years for women and SC/ST candidates.
Eligibility.Reservations: 22.5% of fellowships are reserved for SC/ST candidates who fulfill the qualifications. If SC/ST candidates are unavailable, the slots will be made available to general candidates.

Objectives: To provide an opportunity for research scholars to undertake advanced study and research in engineering and technology, leading to a Ph.D., except for subjects like geology and geophysics.

Fellowship.JRF: ₹14,000 per month for the first two years
Fellowship.SRF: ₹15,000 per month for the remaining period after satisfactory evaluation

Contingency.JRF: ₹12,000 per annum for the first two years
Contingency.SRF: ₹25,000 per annum for the remaining period

Fellowship.Departmental Assistance: ₹3,000 per annum to the host institute for infrastructure support
Fellowship.Escorts/Reader Assistance: ₹2,000 per month for physically handicapped and blind candidates
Fellowship.House Rent Allowance (HRA): As per institutional rules or reimbursement if accommodation is not provided

Benefits.Medical Assistance: No fixed medical assistance is provided. Fellows may avail medical facilities available at the institution.

Leave.Leave Entitlement: 30 days per year plus public holidays. Additional leave provisions for women candidates (maternity leave of 135 days).
Leave.Leave Without Fellowship: Up to one year for teaching assignments or up to three months in other cases.

Application Process.Step 1: Applications must be submitted online in the prescribed format via advertisements published once a year.
Application Process.Step 2: Shortlisted candidates will be called for an interview, and selection will be based on merit.
Application Process.Step 3: Candidates must submit a Joining Report signed by their supervisor or head of department once selected.

Documents Required: Proof of Date of Birth (Birth Certificate or Class 10 Marksheet)
Certificate from the head of the department/institution

Scheme Name: National Renewable Energy Internship (NREI) Scheme
Description: The NREI Scheme by the Ministry of New and Renewable Energy (MNRE) offers internship opportunities for students and professionals to gain experience in the renewable energy sector. The scheme is open to students pursuing undergraduate, graduate, or post-graduate degrees or research scholars in recognized institutions within India or abroad, with a focus on renewable energy.
Purpose: To provide interns with an opportunity to learn about the Ministry’s functioning, renewable energy programs, policies, and issues, and contribute by generating reports, technical analysis, and policy papers.

Eligibility.Qualifications: Applicants must be pursuing a graduate or post-graduate degree in Engineering, Management, Law, Science, or Renewable Energy from a recognized institution within India or abroad, or be working in the Renewable Energy field.
Eligibility.Additional Notes: MNRE may relax eligibility criteria for deserving candidates.

Internship Details.Duration: Internships last between 2 to 6 months, starting from the date of joining.
Internship Details.Internship Frequency: The internship is available twice a year based on MNRE requirements.
Internship Details.Repetition/Extension: No intern is allowed to repeat or extend the internship.

Benefits.Stipend: ₹15,000 per month for physical internships only. No stipend for virtual internships.
Benefits.Certificate: Certificates will be issued upon satisfactory completion of the internship and evaluation of the report/paper.
Benefits.Logistics Support: Internet facilities and other necessities for physical internships. Interns must have their own laptops and make their own lodging and boarding arrangements.

Application Process.Step 2: Fill in the Online Application Form, upload required documents, and self-attest them if necessary.
Application Process.Step 3: Click 'Submit' and note down the Application ID for future reference.
Additional Notes: Applications are accepted on a half-yearly basis, preferably in July and January.
The intern must clearly indicate their area of interest from MNRE's research and program areas.
The application should be submitted at least one month before the expected date of joining and not more than three months in advance.

Selection Process.Step 1: Applications will be scrutinized by a Selection Committee.
Selection Process.Step 2: Selected candidates will receive offers based on available slots, the concerned Division's consent, and the Selection Committee’s approval. The list of selected candidates will be posted on the MNRE website.

Documents Required: Passing Certificate / Degree / Marksheet of Graduation / Post Graduation
Letter from Supervisor/Head of Department/Principal indicating applicant's status
No Objection Certificate (NOC) from the institution
Identity Card / Proof of Enrollment in the Institute
Additional Notes: Selected candidates must present original mark sheets and NOC at the time of joining.
Interns must submit a 'Declaration of Secrecy' to the Ministry before reporting for the internship.

Scheme Name: Dr. S. Radhakrishnan UGC Post-Doctoral Fellowship
Description: The Dr. S. Radhakrishnan UGC Post-Doctoral Fellowship is provided by the University Grants Commission (UGC) to support post-doctoral research in various disciplines including Sciences, Engineering, Technology, Humanities, Social Sciences, and Languages at Indian Universities/Institutions.
Objective: To provide an opportunity for advanced studies and research in various fields and assist young researchers in launching their academic/research career.

Fellowship Details.Reservation Policy: 30% of slots reserved for women candidates.
Fellowship Details.Contingency Grant Usage: Can be used for minor equipment, chemicals, research-specific items (less than ₹50,000), not for international travel or furniture.

Accommodation.Hostel Accommodation: Provided by institution, eligible to draw only hostel fees excluding mess, electricity, etc.
Accommodation.HRA: Available if the scholar arranges accommodation, as per the ceiling of the Government of India.

Medical Assistance: No separate/fixed medical assistance, but scholars may avail medical facilities at their institutions.

Leave Entitlement.Earned Leave: 30 days per year, in addition to public holidays.
Leave Entitlement.Maternity/Paternity Leave: As per Government of India norms.
Leave Entitlement.Intermittent Break for Women Scholars: Up to 1 year in total, with no fellowship during the break.
Leave Entitlement.Academic Leave: For academic/teaching assignments or foreign visits related to research, but no fellowship is paid during academic leave.

Candidate Eligibility.PhD Requirement: Unemployed candidates with a Ph.D. degree in relevant fields (Sciences, Engineering, Technology, Humanities, Social Sciences, including Languages).
Candidate Eligibility.Age Limit: Below 35 years (with relaxation of 5 years for SC/ST/OBC (Non-Creamy Layer)/Women/PWD/Transgender).
Candidate Eligibility.Other Fellowship: Candidates availing other fellowships/remuneration must resign from them before accepting the UGC fellowship.
Candidate Eligibility.Academic Requirement: Minimum 55% marks at the postgraduate level (5% relaxation for reserved categories).
Candidate Eligibility.Mentor Requirement: Candidates must identify a mentor at a recognized institution and obtain consent.

Mentor Eligibility.Faculty Status: Mentor must be a regular faculty at Associate Professor level or above.
Mentor Eligibility.PhD Requirement: Mentor must have a Ph.D. degree.
Mentor Eligibility.Experience: Mentor must have supervised at least 3 Ph.D. theses.

Institution Types: Universities under section 2(f) of UGC Act, 1956 with valid NAAC accreditation.
Deemed Universities under section 3 of UGC Act, 1956 with valid NAAC accreditation.
Central/State Government funded institutions authorized to award degrees.

Application Process.Step 1: Read the UGC guidelines carefully on the official website.
Application Process.Step 2: Register as a new user on the UGC website for the fellowship scheme.
Application Process.Step 3: Login using credentials sent via email and fill out the application form.
Application Process.Step 4: Fill in eligibility details and provide required educational and research information.
Application Process.Step 5: Upload required documents such as passport-size photograph, research proposal, abstract, and No Objection Certificate from the proposed mentor.
Application Process.Step 6: Submit the application, and ensure all fields are complete before final submission.

Documents Required: Scanned passport-size photograph and signature (max size: 1 MB, format: jpg).
No Objection Certificate from Mentor/Supervisor (signed by Mentor, HOD, Registrar).
Application Submission: No hard copies of the application form are accepted. Only online submissions are accepted.

Scheme Name: Padho Pardesh Scheme
Description: The Padho Pardesh scheme provides interest subsidies to meritorious minority students pursuing master's, M.Phil, or Ph.D. degrees abroad. It aims to support economically weaker students from notified minority communities in accessing higher education opportunities abroad and enhancing employability.
Objective: To offer interest subsidies on education loans for minority students pursuing higher education abroad, enabling better opportunities for personal and professional development.
Eligible Subjects: Information Technology (including Computer Engineering, Software, Software Quality Assurance, Networking/Connectivity Engineering, Communication Systems)
