Benefits.Financial Assistance: Interest subsidy on education loans to reduce the cost of overseas education.
Benefits.Access to Education: Makes overseas education more accessible to minority students from economically weaker sections.
Benefits.Improved Employability: Studying abroad provides a competitive edge in the global job market.
Benefits.Personal and Professional Development: Studying abroad enhances students' skills and knowledge in a global context.

Eligibility.Admission Requirement: Must be admitted to an approved master's, M.Phil, or Ph.D. program abroad in a recognized university/institution.
Eligibility.Income Limit: Family income must not exceed ₹6,00,000 per annum.
Eligibility.Loan Requirement: Must have obtained an education loan from a scheduled bank under the Indian Banks Association (IBA) Education Loan Scheme.
Eligibility.Application Timeframe: Application must be made during the first year of study (applications received in the second year or later will not be accepted).
Eligibility.Priority: Priority given to applications from states and union territories with lower bank interest rates.
Eligibility.Aadhaar Linking: Payment of financial benefits may be linked to the student's Aadhaar number.

Application Process.Step 1: Open the official website for the Padho Pardesh scheme.
Application Process.Step 3: Fill in the required details including ISD code, mobile number, and email ID.
Application Process.Step 4: Submit the details to proceed with the application.

Documents Required: Admission letter from the institution abroad

Scheme Name: Free Coaching Scheme for SC and OBC Students
Description: This scheme, implemented by the Department of Social Justice and Empowerment in collaboration with Dr. Ambedkar Foundation (DAF), aims to provide quality coaching to economically disadvantaged SC and OBC students for competitive examinations, thereby enhancing their chances of securing public/private sector jobs or admission to reputed technical and professional higher education institutions.
Objective: To enable SC and OBC candidates to prepare for competitive exams for better employment opportunities or admission into prestigious institutions for higher education.

Implementation.Ministry: Ministry of Social Justice and Empowerment
Implementation.Method: Direct selection of students, who can undertake coaching in any institute of their choice.

Category-wise Ratio.SC Students: At least 70%, with a possible relaxation to 50% if sufficient SC candidates are not available.
Category-wise Ratio.Female Candidates: 30% reservation under each category, with flexibility if there are insufficient female candidates.

Benefits.Stipend: ₹4000 per month for the duration of the course (up to 12 months)
Benefits.Incentive: ₹15,000 for successful students who clear the mains stage of Central/State Civil Services Exams (Class 1 and Class 2 posts).

Mode of Payment.Payment Method: Direct Bank Transfer (DBT) to Aadhaar-enabled bank accounts
Mode of Payment.Installments: First installment of 50% released at the start of the course, second installment after 75% of course duration.

Courses for Coaching: Group A and B exams (UPSC, SSC, RRBs)
State Public Service Commission Exams (Group A and B)
Premier Entrance Examinations (Engineering - IIT-JEE, Medical - NEET, Management - CAT, Law - CLAT)
Eligibility tests (SAT, GRE, GMAT, IELTS, TOEFL)
National Defence Academy, Combined Defence Services, and CPL Courses

Student Criteria.Income: Annual family income should be ₹8,00,000 or less

Education.For Class 12th Based Exams: Should have passed class 12th or be studying in class 12th
Education.For Under Graduate Based Exams: Should have completed or be in the final year of an undergraduate course

Student Criteria.Benefits Limit: A student can avail the benefits up to two times, irrespective of the number of attempts for exams.

University Criteria.Seats Allocation: Maximum of 100 seats per Central University, with a minimum of 50 students per university for viability.
University Criteria.Courses Allocation: Each university can offer a maximum of 4 courses, with at least 25 students per course.

Exclusions: Students with less than 50% marks in Class 10th (for 12th-based exams) or Class 12th (for undergrad-based exams) are not eligible.

Application Process.Step 1: Central Universities issue advertisements inviting applications from eligible students.
Application Process.Step 2: Students apply online on the Free Coaching Scheme Portal with details of the course they intend to join.

Timelines.Coaching Fee Release Deadline: Within 1 month of fee receipt submission
Timelines.Stipend Release Deadline: 30 days from hall ticket upload and self-certification

Documents Required: Declaration of not availing benefits more than twice
Declaration of not availing benefits under any other coaching scheme
Notes: If the student does not have an Aadhaar number at the time of application, they can submit their EID number, but payments will only be made after obtaining an Aadhaar number.
Income certificates for self-employed parents must be issued by a Revenue Officer, not below the rank of Tehsildar.

Scheme Name: PM-YASASVI: Top Class School Education for OBC, EBC and DNT Students
Description: A sub-scheme under PM Young Achievers Scholarship Award Scheme (PM-YASASVI), launched by the Ministry of Social Justice & Empowerment to provide educational assistance to meritorious students from OBC, EBC, and DNT categories for studying in top-class schools from Class 9 to Class 12.
Objective: To provide premium education to meritorious students belonging to OBC, EBC, and DNT categories by funding their education from Class 9 onwards till they complete Class 12.

Eligibility Criteria.Schools: Top Class Schools (TCS) identified by the scheme

Scope and Coverage.Slots Allocation: Based on OBC population data for each state. A minimum of 30% scholarships reserved for girls.

Modalities.Selection of Schools: Schools with consistent 100% pass rate in Classes 10 and 12, selected by a committee.
Modalities.Types of Schools: Public (Central/State/Local Body), aided, and private schools.
Modalities.State Slots Announcement: Slots for each state and class announced in April each year.

Benefits.Covered Expenses: Tuition fee, hostel fee, and other charges as required by the school
Benefits.Installments: Payment released in installments before 15th August each year.

Student Criteria.Income: Household income must be less than ₹2.5 Lakhs
Student Criteria.Merit: Must be studying in a top-class school from Class 9 to Class 12

School Criteria.Aadhaar-Based Attendance: Schools must integrate Aadhaar-based attendance system if required.

Eligibility.Exclusions: Students receiving benefits under any other government scheme for similar items will not be eligible.

New Registration.Step 1: Visit NSP and click 'New Registration' under Applicant Corner.
New Registration.Step 2: Read the instructions, provide the undertaking, and click continue.
New Registration.Step 3: Fill out the registration form with required details.

Registered Applicants.Step 1: Log in to NSP with your application ID & password.
Registered Applicants.Step 2: Click on 'Fresh Application' under Applicant Corner.
Registered Applicants.Step 3: Select the scholarship and fill out the application form.
Registered Applicants.Step 4: Upload the required documents and submit.

Selection Process.Verification: Nodal officers of the schools will verify the applications online, followed by confirmation from the State Government.
Selection Process.Merit List: State-wise merit lists will be prepared based on the marks obtained in the previous class, with separate lists for boys and girls.

Documents Required: Valid Income certificate issued by the competent authority
Caste/Community Certificate issued by the competent authority

Scheme Name: Student Internship Program
Description: A learning opportunity for students to gain exposure to the functioning of the CAG of India. Interns will be engaged on a contract basis for 3 to 6 months in Regional Capacity Building and Knowledge Institutes.

Eligibility.Academic Qualification: Undergraduate, Postgraduate, or Research students from recognized institutions with a stellar academic record
Preferred Attributes: Skills in Information Technology (IT) & Information Communication Technology (ICT)
Other Requirements: Must sign a Secrecy and Non-Disclosure Agreement before reporting for the internship
Must comply with the laws of secrecy of the country
Shall not be entitled to leave during the internship period

Place of Posting: CAG’s office in New Delhi or any field office across India
Number of Interns: Varies based on the requirement from time to time

Benefits.Remuneration: ₹12,000/- per month (all-inclusive), paid on completion of the internship and submission of Report/Paper
Benefits.Logistics Support: Office space, computer with internet access
Benefits.Outplacement: Experience Certificate / Recommendatory letter upon successful completion

Travel and Perks.Travel: No TA/DA will be provided for interviews or during the internship
Other Perks: No accommodation, residential phone, conveyance, or medical reimbursements
No compensation in case of death, injury, or illness during the internship

Steps: Read the instructions carefully
Fill in all the required details in the form
Submit the form
Application Process.Note: Candidates should also visit the official CAG website for the latest updates.

Documents Required: Report/Paper on the assigned subject at the end of the internship

Conditions.Secrecy: Interns must sign a Secrecy and Non-Disclosure Agreement before commencement
Conditions.Internship Status: The internship does not constitute a job or employment in CAG or Indian Audit & Accounts Department
Conditions.Leave: Interns are not entitled to leave during the internship
Conditions.Working Hours: Same as regular office hours, no extra remuneration for overtime

Scheme Name: Internship Programme at Serious Fraud Investigation Office
Description: The SFIO Internship Programme aims to provide a platform for young scholars and researchers from reputed academic institutions in fields like Economics, Commerce, Law, Management, Computer Forensics, and professional courses from ICAI, CMA, and ICSI. Interns will gain hands-on experience and interact with officers of SFIO, including its Regional Offices.
Duration: Minimum of one month and a maximum of two months
Declaration of Secrecy: Interns must furnish a Declaration of Secrecy prior to the commencement of the internship.

Benefits.Stipend: ₹7,000/- per month during the internship period
Benefits.Certificate of Internship: Certificate awarded upon satisfactory completion and submission of an end-of-assignment report, evaluated by the concerned official of SFIO

Eligibility.National: The applicant must be an Indian National
Academic Qualifications: Post Graduate Courses - MBA (Finance), Law Students in 4th/5th Year of a five-year stream with excellent academic records
Post-graduation with at least 55% marks in graduation, pursuing Masters/Research in Economics/Finance/Management/Law/Computer Forensics from recognized universities

Students in the final year or equivalent of ICAI, ICAI(CMA), ICSI, Central Universities, AICTE recognized financial/Economic Institutions, National Management Institutes, Foreign Universities and Institutions of Excellence
For Graduate Applicants - Must have secured First Class Degree in Graduation

Steps: Download and fill the application form from the official SFIO website
Institutions must send the duly filled and signed forms along with self-attested documents to kundanlal@sfio.nic.in
Institutions should also indicate a convenient time for the student to join the internship and the permissible duration as per the academic curriculum
Final selection will be made based on the suitability of the students and availability of positions

At the end of the Internship: Assignment Report on the allotted subject (to be presented to the Director, SFIO)
Feedback on the experience of the internship program

Other Notes: The internship will not constitute a job or assurance of a job with the Serious Fraud Investigation Office.

Scheme Name: Merit Cum Means Based Scholarship For Students Belonging To The Minority Communities
Description: A scholarship scheme by the Ministry of Minority Affairs for students from minority communities pursuing technical and professional courses at undergraduate and postgraduate levels in listed institutes. The scholarship aims to lighten the financial burden on education for minority communities and provide a level playing field in the competitive employment arena.

Benefits.Course Fee: ₹20,000/- per annum, subject to actuals (whichever is less) for both Hosteller & Day Scholar

Monthly Maintenance Allowance.Hosteller: ₹1,000/- for 10 months in an academic year
Monthly Maintenance Allowance.Day Scholar: ₹500/- for 10 months in an academic year

Benefits.Scholarship for Listed Institutes: Full course fee reimbursed for listed institutes

Eligibility.Community: The applicant must belong to a Minority Community
Eligibility.Course: The applicant must be pursuing a technical or professional course at the undergraduate or postgraduate level
Eligibility.Marks: The applicant must have secured not less than 50% marks (or equivalent grade) in the previous final examination
Eligibility.Income: The annual income of the parents/guardians of the applicant from all sources must be less than or equal to ₹2.5 Lakhs per annum

Exclusions: The scholarship may be suspended or canceled if the student violates school discipline or any other terms and conditions of the scholarship
Students availing any other scholarship for SC/ST/OBC/minority categories will not be eligible
The scholarship will be canceled if it is obtained through false statements and the amount paid will be recovered by the concerned State/UT Govt
Students will not be allowed to avail of benefits under any other scheme for the same purpose
No more than two students from a family can receive the scholarship

Steps: Visit the New Registration page on the National Scholarships Portal
Accept the Terms and Conditions and click 'Next'
Enter your mobile number and OTP, and click 'Verify'
Complete the e-KYC process and receive your reference number
For OTR ID number generation, download and install AadhaarFaceRD services and NSP OTR App on your device, perform face authentication, and receive OTR number
For Fresh Application, log in using your OTR number and password, complete the application form, and upload the required documents
Submit the application form either as a draft or final submission

When Applying: Income Certificate issued by a Competent Authority
Self-Certified or Parent/Guardian Certified Community Certificate (if applicable)
Self-attested Mark Sheet of the last qualifying exam
Fee Receipt for the current course year
Bank Details of the applicant or parent/guardian (if applicable)
Bonafide Student Certificate (if the institute is located in a different State/UT)
Aadhaar Number or alternative identification documents
Alternative Identification Documents (if: Certificate of Identity from School Principal or Headmaster
Any other documents as specified by the State Government or Union Territory Administration

Tracking Payment Status: Track payment status via the 'Know Your Payment' template in the Public Financial Management System (PFMS) Portal by providing Aadhaar number, Bank Account number, or NSP Application ID.
Important Notes: Students must submit renewal applications before the cut-off date for that year
The National Scholarships Portal will provide timelines for opening and closing of the portal
Applications will be verified by the Institute and the concerned State Higher Education Department

Scheme Name: Post Matric Scholarship Scheme for Scheduled Tribe Students
Description: A centrally sponsored scholarship scheme by the Ministry of Tribal Affairs for ST students pursuing post-matriculation or post-secondary courses in India.
Eligibility: Scheduled Tribe students who have passed Matriculation or Higher Secondary examinations or equivalent, and whose parents’/guardians’ combined annual income does not exceed ₹2,00,000.
Required Documents: Certificates of examinations passed (Diplomas, Degrees, etc.)
Caste Certificate (signed by Revenue Officer, not below Tahsildar)
Income Declaration (affidavit for self-employed or income certificate for employed parents)
Receipt of last year’s scholarship (for renewal)
